Title: Limit access
Body: Ensure information is accessible only for authorized purposes and shared only with those authorized to receive it.
Knowledge Title: Secure Access and Information Sharing Landing Page

Title: Revoke permissions
Body: Revoke permissions when a user no longer needs access to information (e.g., upon project completion or job change).
Knowledge Title: Secure Access and Information Sharing Landing Page

Title: Review user access
Body: Review which user accounts have access to information at this level regularly - at least annually.
Knowledge Title: Secure Access and Information Sharing Landing Page

Title: Screen lock
Body: Enable a screen lock that requires a password to unlock after 15 minutes of inactivity.
Knowledge Title: Startup and Screen Lock Passwords Landing Page

Title: Least privilege
Body: Use separate accounts for user and administrative permissions.
Knowledge Title: Setup Separate User and Admin Privileged Accounts Landing Page

Title: Operating system firewall
Body: Enable your operating system's firewall.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Firewalls Landing Page

Title: Security awareness training
Body: Train all users with access to ensure understanding of their responsibilities with regard to handling information.
Knowledge Title: Security Training Landing Page

Title: Centralized logging
Body: Ensure authentication and access logs are sent to a second device.
Knowledge Title: Centralized Access Logging Landing Page

Title: Endpoint management
Body: Where applicable, use Endpoint management tools to ensure the tasks for this level are completed on your devices.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Service or Tool Title: Casper, Casper Software Center, Microsoft SCCM, SCCM Software Center
Knowledge Title: System Administrator Security Preventative Measures Landing Page

Title: Vendor-supported applications
Body: Use vendor supported applications and operating systems.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Automatic Updates and Patching Landing Page

Title: Automatic software updates
Body: Configure automatic download and application of software and operating system updates.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Automatic Updates and Patching Landing Page

Title: Patch notification
Body: Stay informed of available patches for your operating system and applications.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Service or Tool Title: Software Patches and OS Updates, RHN: Red Hat Network for Linux, WAUS: MIT Windows Automatic Update Service
Knowledge Title: Automatic Updates and Patching

Title: Network vulnerability scans
Body: Perform regular network vulnerability scans. Contact your departmental IT administrator or security@mit.edu for assistance.
Knowledge Title: System Administrator Security Preventative Measures Landing Page

Title: Perform regular backups
Body: Set up and perform regular backups.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Data Backup Landing Page

Title: Encrypted backups
Body: Backup solution encrypts information in transit and at rest.
Service or Tool Title: CrashPlan, TSM (Tivoli Storage Manager), Backup, Encryption
Knowledge Title: Data Backup Landing Page

Title: File encryption
Body: Use file level encryption when sharing files on platforms like email, Dropbox, Slack. Encryption keys must be shared via another method.
Knowledge Title: Data Encryption Landing Page

Title: Encrypt portable devices
Body: Enable whole disk encryption on portable devices.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Data Encryption Landing Page

Title: Encrypt portable media
Body: Enable whole disk encryption on portable media.
Knowledge Title: Data Encryption Landing Page

Title: Encryption in transit
Body: Information at this level is transmitted over an encrypted connection.
Knowledge Title: Encrypted Connections Landing Page

Title: Install malware protection
Body: Install malware protection applications, if available for the platform.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Service or Tool Title: CrowdStrike, Sophos Anti-Virus, Virus Detection and Prevention
Knowledge Title: Computing Virus and Malware Landing Page

Title: Remote wipe
Body: Enable the use of remote wipe and geographic location software on portable devices.
Knowledge Title: Mobile and Portable Device Security Practices Landing Page

Title: Loss prevention software
Body: Install data loss prevention software.
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page

Title: Password at startup
Body: Enable password protection at startup.
Knowledge Title: Startup and Screen Lock Passwords Landing Page

Title: Multi-factor authentication on servers
Body: Utilize multi-factor authentication for remote interactive user and administrator logins.
Knowledge Title: Duo Authentication Landing Page

Title: Multi-factor authentication Endpoints
Body: Utilize multi-factor authentication for remote access.
Knowledge Title: Duo Authentication

Title: Use strong passwords
Body: Use strong passwords. Change authentication keys e.g., password, certificate, regularly - at least annually.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Passwords and Identities Landing Page

Title: Don't reuse passwords
Body: Do not reuse passwords for multiple services. Do not use your Kerberos password for non-Kerberos enabled systems.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Passwords and Identities Landing Page

Title: Unique user accounts
Body: Create a unique, non-privileged, account for each user. Assign a different password for user and administrative accounts.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Setup Separate User and Admin Privileged Accounts Landing Page

Title: Encrypt passwords
Body: Store and transmit only encrypted passwords.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Passwords and Identities Landing Page

Title: Compromised passwords
Body: Change passwords immediately if a compromise is suspected.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Passwords and Identities Landing Page

Title: Default passwords
Body: Change default vendor-supplied passwords and remove default accounts.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Passwords and Identities Landing Page

Title: Data inventory
Body: Create and maintain an information inventory that includes classification level, information owner, and users with access.
Knowledge Title: Data, Application, and Authorization Inventory Landing Page

Title: Inventory of systems
Body: Create and maintain an inventory of systems that includes device ownership, contact information, and network configuration.
Knowledge Title: Data, Application, and Authorization Inventory Landing Page

Title: Inventory of applications
Body: Maintain a list of applications that includes assigned risk classification level, data volume, and users with access.
Knowledge Title: Data, Application, and Authorization Inventory Landing Page

Title: Physical security of storage
Body: Restrict physical access to any storage facility that contains physical media with this level of information. Only authorized individuals may have access either through a physical or electronic key.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Limit physical access
Body: Limit physical access to organizational systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Data center
Body: Place system hardware in a data center.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Secure file cabinets
Body: Lock hard copy information records in a file cabinet within a locked office.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Copiers & shared devices
Body: Remove information on copiers, fax machines, or other shared devices promptly.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Transfer physical media
Body: Use appropriately secure means when transferring physical media containing information. Track transfers to confirm that they reached the intended recipient.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Fax machines
Body: Fax records to a non-public fax machine only if arrangements have been made so that the intended recipient will take the copies off the machine immediately upon receipt.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Traveling with media
Body: Plan ahead to keep paper research data and forms (e.g., field notes, observations, interviews, informed consents) secure while traveling abroad.
Knowledge Title: Physical Access Landing Page

Title: Self assessment
Body: Review your systems and procedures regularly to ensure the tasks for this risk level are applied.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Data, Application and Authorization Inventory Landing Page

Title: Annual review
Body: Contact security@mit.edu for an annual review to verify that all security tasks are working properly.
Knowledge Title: Annual Security Review Landing Page

Title: Incident reporting
Body: Promptly report actual or suspected compromise, including loss, theft, improper use, modification of, or access to information to security@mit.edu.
Risk Level: Low Risk, Medium Risk, High Risk
Knowledge Title: Report a Security Incident Landing Page

Title: HIPAA or PHI
Body: If you handle Protected Health Information (PHI), there may be additional tasks to complete. Please contact infoprotect@mit.edu.
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page

Title: Implement PCI-DSS tasks
Body: If you are accepting credit card payments, you may need to complete additional tasks. Please contact infoprotect@mit.edu
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page

Title: Implement NIST 800-171 controls
Body: If you have received data as part of a sponsored research project, and your contract includes clauses on data security there may be additional tasks. Please contact infoprotect@mit.edu.
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page

Title: Design requirement
Body: If you are developing (or contracting a vendor to develop) applications processing this level of information, include security as a design requirement.
Knowledge Title: Secure Software Development Practices Landing Page

Title: Code review
Body: If you are developing (or contracting a vendor to develop) applications processing this level of information, review code and correct flaws prior to deployment.
Knowledge Title: Secure Software Development Practices Landing Page

Title: Data retention
Body: Observe applicable data retention policies upon project completion. Securely delete the information if possible. If you must retain a copy of information at this level, ensure that it remains secure.
Knowledge Title: Data Retention and Deletion Landing Page

Title: Secure deletion
Body: Securely delete information when it is no longer required by means that make it impossible to reconstruct the records.
Knowledge Title: Data Retention and Deletion Landing Page

Title: Secure destruction
Body: Destroy devices and media that are no longer needed in a way such that no information can be recovered.
Knowledge Title: Data Retention and Deletion Landing Page

Title: Minimize information
Body: Limit the storage and collection of data at this risk level to that which is necessary to accomplish the legitimate purpose for which it is collected.
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page

Title: Anonymize information
Body: Anonymize information whenever possible and separate access to identified and de-identified data sets. For physical media store identified information in a separate locked file cabinet.
Knowledge Title: Data Storage Risk Reduction Landing Page
